subject: Programming
title: The Power of Code Review
description: A quick win: understand The Power of Code Review.

hook.text: The Heartbleed bug sat in OpenSSL's code for two years before anyone noticed.

buildup.text: One developer wrote the code. One reviewer approved it. Nobody else looked.

discovery.text: Studies show code review catches 60-90% of defects â€” far more than testing alone.

twist.text: Speed pressure makes teams skip reviews. They save hours now and lose weeks debugging later.

climax.text: The cheapest security tool is a second pair of eyes reading your code before it ships.

punchline.text: Two eyes miss what four eyes catch.

quiz.question: What percentage of defects can code review catch according to studies?
